summary: The White Walkers tocam “Seven Kingdom Army”
title: The White Walkers tocam “Seven Kingdom Army”
body:
The White Walkers tocam “Seven Kingdom Army”

Este é o som dos The White Walkers, tocando a música “Seven Kingdom Army”, uma releitura da música do The White Stripes, “Seven Nation Army” com a temática do Game of Thrones.

O clipe é extremamente bem produzido, e a música traz a letra totalmente inspirada no seriado da HBO, que conta sobre os Caminhantes Brancos e a sua conquista no mundo de Westeros.

Todos os efeitos especiais,…

View On WordPress

summary: I think it’s important to have different representations of femininity across media. We need characters like Sansa who are more...
question: I think it’s important to have different representations of femininity across media. We need characters like Sansa who are more traditionally feminine and use different approaches to rebelling and fighting back than is typically shown on media. Arya’s character is also important though and shouldn’t be shamed for her personality either. Many girls including myself relate to Arya and her struggle to conform to traditional standards. I believe it’s important to show multiple representations
answer:
Of characters like GOT does pretty well in the books. I don’t see any issue with carol wearing makeup other than it’s unrealistic for an apocalypse to wear makeup. Women can be fighters and do non traditional stuff while wearing makeup or doing feminine things most girls are a mix. It wouldn’t shock me for Arya to begin to do more traditionally feminine things like wearing dresses and stuff because he’s starting to describe her as beautiful and she’s becoming more involved with adult feminine

Activities. Like how she’s working in a brothel and learning how to manipulate men. I like that we’re starting to see different representations of women in media. We see girls like Sansa who are more traditional and it’s not a bad thing, girls like Arya who are more tomboyish but maybe will be a mix of both, women like Brienne who are much more masculine than feminine, and women like Cat whose femininity is often represented by motherhood but she’s still very fierce.

I understand people’s frustrations with femininity esp on TV and film where female characters fight with heels and are impeccably groomed in post apocalyptic settings. Yes a lot of the times GNC women are the butt of the joke (so are feminine women) and yes we should highlight that and call it out. Despite this feminine characters are groundbreaking in many genres, femininity being represented as valid can be groundbreaking depending on how it’s written and so on.

summary: A Life Lesson from The Game of Thrones
title: A Life Lesson from The Game of Thrones
body:
A Life Lesson from The Game of Thrones

Game of Thrones is back for its final season this week. This video comes from the beautiful city walls of Ávila, about 100kms to the west of Madrid in Spain.

I used to think that it was enough to be good at your job, and to be nice to people… and money, success and power would come. How wrong I was. The Game of Thrones…

blog.name: latenightsinpemberley
blog.title: “..do you always recite poetry when you drink?”
blog.description: Feminist. Bisexual. Greek. Citizen of the world in the making. Interests include world history, high fantasy, period dramas, leftist politics and supporting women's liberation from patriarchy. A bit too fixated on Latin American and Mediterranean cultures. Lover of languages. I take my coffee with an extra pinch of sarcasm and rant a lot about female characters.

summary: The north not because Sansa earned the Vales loyalty lol she just expected the freefolk to fight for her she hasn’t earned any...
question: The north not because Sansa earned the Vales loyalty lol she just expected the freefolk to fight for her she hasn’t earned any army’s loyalty lol. Jon fought by their sides he died for the freefolk and he almost died in the BotB. Sansa held vital information that got thousands of people killed she didn’t give two shits about saving the freefolk she didn’t care about saving anyone. Northern Independence is going to look so good when the NK kills everyone and they’re all wights!
answer:
And yet it wasn’t the freefolk or Jon Snow that won the battle and won back Winterfell.

Though I’m sure they’d all enjoy their heroism and honour quite thoroughly as their corpses rotted on the ground anon.

Also, you know that *both* help with the white walkers and a Northern Independence deal could have been negotiated right? There’s no guarantee it would be successful but no harm in trying.

And let’s not pretend Northerners won’t join the army of the dead for any other reason other than the goodness of Dany’s heart, much less Jon Snow’s nonexistent negotiative skills.

tags: a song of ice and fire
title: The GoT endgame...
body:
I’ve been on sick leave since last monday & i’ve had loads of time to rewatch some GoT episodes and i’ve been reading a wiki of ice and fire articles and GoT wiki articles and theories videos and character development videos and i’ve been thinking A LOT about how it’s gonna end and who else is gonna die.. I still have a tiny bit of hope we might see the Night’s King and his story (although very unlikely as it’s “too complex” to fit into 6 episodes) as the child he had with the Night’s Queen could very well be Azor Ahai aka the prince that was promised during the Battle for the Dawn or it could be the Night’s King himself who would kill his Night’s Queen to create Lightbringer, negotiate a Pact and send the White Walkers back to The Lands of Always Winter with a promise of some kind of sacrifice.. So basically all the Starks have White Walkers’ blood in them because the 13th Lord Commander of the Nights Watch was actually a Stark who became the Night’s King. He and his wife performed blood magic and human sacrifices to the gods of Winter so my theory goes like this: thousands and thousands of years have passed since the Battle of the Dawn, where White Walkers made the Pact with Children and the First Men about how to keep the peace and I’m sure it involved some kind of arangement about human sacrifices. people have forgotten about it, forgotten about the Children of the forest, White Walkers, basically all magic was forgotten and believed to be gone. With this the people also stopped offering human sacrifices to the White Walkers (like Craster did. Also note that White Walkers can’t copulate and reproduce with each other so they turn babies into wights - basically they’re just trying to survive and keep their ‘race’ alive, so to speak). Then also the birth of the Dragons, one of the biggest threats to the existence of the Walkers could be the catalyst for them to march south.

There’s also the saying “There must always be a Stark in Winterfell” because the Starks are the only people who can negotiate with the White Walkers BECAUSE they have the Walker’s blood in them (descendants of the Night’s King and Queen - that’s why they don’t fare well in the south, they were made for winter and cold) so when the Starks left Winterfell was the moment when they really started causing terror.

I’m absolutely NOT pleased with the show’s story that Children of the forest created White Walkers as a defence against the First Men. It’s way too clean and way to simplified. And it doesn’t really explain the reason they’ve started marching their armies south at exactly that moment. Just because they want to kill all the living? Naaah, that’s way too simple. The White Walkers were always there, even before the First Men, they are the Winter that is coming and you can’t really create or destroy Winter, it comes sooner or later.

I’d love to discuss this with anyone so please share & comment with your opinions and theories and what do you think is gonna happen.

PS: I’m pretty sure Arya won’t make it until the end. She’s escaped the Many Faced God a few times already, I’m afraid the time is running out for her.

summary: #GameofThrones star, Emilia Clarke shares photos from hospital as she received treatment for brain aneurysm
title: #GameofThrones star, Emilia Clarke shares photos from hospital as she received treatment for brain aneurysm
body:
#GameofThrones star, Emilia Clarke shares photos from hospital as she received treatment for brain aneurysm

HBO Series, Game Of Thrones star, Emilia Clarke, took the world by surprise after she revealed she had just finished filming the first series of Game of Thrones when she suffered a devastating brain haemorrhage that left her in intensive care.

She managed to get back to work, filming other seasons of the show and putting on a brave face while going in and out the of hospital.

Her story came as a…

View On WordPress

HBO Series, Game Of Thrones star, Emilia Clarke, took the world by surprise after she revealed she had just finished filming the first series of Game of Thrones when she suffered a devastating brain haemorrhage that left her in intensive care.

External image

She managed to get back to work, filming other seasons of the show and putting on a brave face while going in and out the of hospital.

blog.name: latenightsinpemberley
blog.title: “..do you always recite poetry when you drink?”
blog.description: Feminist. Bisexual. Greek. Citizen of the world in the making. Interests include world history, high fantasy, period dramas, leftist politics and supporting women's liberation from patriarchy. A bit too fixated on Latin American and Mediterranean cultures. Lover of languages. I take my coffee with an extra pinch of sarcasm and rant a lot about female characters.

summary: Jon Snow died trying to save the wildings and that makes him an idiot?? He’s not the most politically savvy character I’ll give...
question: Jon Snow died trying to save the wildings and that makes him an idiot?? He’s not the most politically savvy character I’ll give you that but he’s spent 7 seasons doing everything he fucking could to just save Westeros he doesn’t give two flying fucks about politics he just wants everyone to live. Sansa couldn’t even get Lady Mormont 62 men she couldn’t get hardly any Northern houses no one would fight Littlefinger brought his men because he wanted to be indebted to Sansa so he could control the
answer: Well if he doesn’t give a flying fuck about politics maybe he should let someone who *does* rule, instead of whining like a five-year-old about how ‘I didn’t want any of this, I’m so humble!’ while miserably failing at his fucking job.

tags: emilia's article simultaneously making me feel sorry for jon and dany
summary: In her new interview, EC said that Dany is so obsessed with Jon that she thinks they're some fated couple that's going to...
question: In her new interview, EC said that Dany is so obsessed with Jon that she thinks they're some fated couple that's going to conquer the world together. Whoa...Talk about delusional dragon lady. Also, Dany can't understand why the Stark Sisters don't like her after she's introduced to them? EC had a real fun time stressing Dany's stupidity when it comes to not understanding regular people. Lol She pretty much mocked Dany's belief that Sansa and Arya would welcome her into the Stark family.
answer:
Meanwhile all Jon wants is for her to help save the North. I wonder if Dany thinks that after the Night King is dead, Jon will help her take the throne. This is why she’ll snap when she learns that Jon has a stronger claim to the Iron Throne, he’s supposed to serve her and while she might be inclined to share some (not a lot) of her power, Dany never imagined he could be her equal at anything. Most of their interactions happened while Jon was a prisoner and eventually he knelt to her, of course she thinks that sets the tone for the rest of their relationship. How anyone thought she’d be happy that Jon is a Targaryen I don’t know?

Emilia also said Dany thinks Jon is the final link which doesn’t make sense because Dany wasn’t looking for someone to complete her and even if she was, how did she decide Jon was the one? Was it the way he never smiled at her or how he never told her anything? It’s also wild that Dany’s surprised Jon’s family doesn’t like her. Sansa is Lady of Winterfell, she’s not a regular sister, she’s a political player and what Jon did was an insult towards her and other Northerners. Whether Dany and her stans want to admit it or not, the North staying independent is a big deal. Dany should have seen this coming but being with Jon dumbed her down.
